name: Pakora Waffles - Savory Chickpea Flour Waffles
description: Pakora Chickpea Flour Waffles are a fun savory vegan breakfast treat or snack! Veggie Pakora fritters are a staple at most Indian restaurants and now you can have them for breakfast - unfried! Gluten-free too! Soyfree Nutfree. Makes 8-9 mini waffles or 4-5 regular size
recipeIngredient: ⅛ tsp carom(ajwain) seeds or cumin seeds
¼ tsp cayenne or red Indian chili powder
2 Tbsp rice flour (or use fine semolina flour )
1 cup chickpea flour (or use 1 cup +2 tbsp besan )

recipeInstructions.text: Chop all of your vegetables and add them to a bowl. Or use a food processor to make a coarsely chopped mixture
recipeInstructions.name: Chop all of your vegetables and add them to a bowl. Or use a food processor to make a coarsely chopped mixture

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rice flour, chickpea flour, salt, spices, cilantro, baking soda and mix everything well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the rice flour, chickpea flour, salt, spices, cilantro, baking soda and mix everything well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in 1 cup of water to the mixture, stir well until combined. Add more water if needed - I need just about 1Tbsp more water when I make this, it really just depends on the amount of moisture leaking from your vegetables as well as the chickpea flour you use.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in 1 cup of water to the mixture, stir well until combined. Add more water if needed - I need just about 1Tbsp more water when I make this, it really just depends on the amount of moisture leaking from your vegetables as well as the chickpea flour you use.

recipeInstructions.text: Let this mixture sit for 5 minutes before starting to make your waffles.
recipeInstructions.name: Let this mixture sit for 5 minutes before starting to make your waffles.

recipeInstructions.text: Oil and preheat your waffle maker - I usually drizzle some oil onto my waffle iron since I like my waffles to get nice and crispy and brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil and preheat your waffle maker - I usually drizzle some oil onto my waffle iron since I like my waffles to get nice and crispy and brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour and spread the thick batter on your waffle maker, spread evenly with a spatula.  keep the batter amount to a medium thick layer for crispy waffles. Too thick will take long to cook and soften faster
recipeInstructions.name: Pour and spread the thick batter on your waffle maker, spread evenly with a spatula.  keep the batter amount to a medium thick layer for crispy waffles. Too thick will take long to cook and soften faster

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle a few drops of oil on the top as well before closing the lid.
recipeInstructions.name: Drizzle a few drops of oil on the top as well before closing the lid.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook until golden brown and crisp, to preference. (These waffles take a while to crisp up so account for all the inactive time when planning. Also keep them thin else the batter gets bready)
recipeInstructions.name: Cook until golden brown and crisp, to preference. (These waffles take a while to crisp up so account for all the inactive time when planning. Also keep them thin else the batter gets bready)

recipeInstructions.text: The waffle maker timer for my iron is pretty short, you may have to experiment to see what’s best for yours. Just make sure you cook it to a golden crisp brown to ensure the vegetables are fully cooked and the waffles get crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: The waffle maker timer for my iron is pretty short, you may have to experiment to see what’s best for yours. Just make sure you cook it to a golden crisp brown to ensure the vegetables are fully cooked and the waffles get crispy.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the waffle from the waffle maker, repeat for all of the batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the waffle from the waffle maker, repeat for all of the batter.

recipeInstructions.text: These waffles are served best when they are warm and crispy, they will soften a bit as they cool off after about 30 mins or so. Serve with ketchup, salsa, chutney or other dressings of choice or serve witb kadhi!
